abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof Eugene R Fidell reproaches Pentagon's investigation into October 2015 bombing of Doctors Without Borders hospital in Kunduz, Afghanistan, noting it is treating case as less serious than it is; argues forgoing trial and possible court-martial sets dangerous precedent for accountability in future conflicts.
lead_paragraph: The American service members involved in the deadly bombardment of an Afghan hospital have not been criminally prosecuted. But they could have been.

headline.main: The Wrong Way to Handle the Kunduz Tragedy
